oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Leather wallet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This leather wallet belonged to Cpl. G. T. Poyner, Co B., 5th Tenn. Inf., CSA. The inside has his name and the number 1865 written inside. The Poyners were a prominent family from the Plant community of Humphreys County, Tenn. Poyner fought a Shiloh, Perryville, and Murfreesboro. He was wounded at New Hope Church, Ga. In May 1864 which necessitated the amputation of all of his toes on his left foot. Assigned to light duty thereafter.
